name: Chicken Curry
history: Chicken Curry is a staple dish in Indian cuisine, with variations found across different regions of the country. It's a flavorful dish that has gained popularity worldwide, known for its aromatic spices and tender chicken.
description: Chicken Curry is a classic Indian dish made with chicken pieces simmered in a sauce of onions, tomatoes, and a rich blend of spices like turmeric, cumin, and coriander. It's often enjoyed with rice or Indian breads like naan.

instructions.title: SautÃ© Onions and Spices
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add onions and ginger-garlic paste, cooking until onions are golden. Mix in turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and red chili powder.

instructions.title: Cook the Chicken
instructions.description: Add chicken pieces to the pan. Cook until they start to brown.

instructions.title: Add Tomatoes and Yogurt
instructions.description: Stir in chopped tomatoes and yogurt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and the chicken is well-coated with the sauce.

instructions.title: Simmer the Curry
instructions.description: Add water to achieve the desired consistency. Bring to a boil, then simmer until the chicken is fully cooked.

instructions.title: Finish with Garam Masala
instructions.description: Stir in garam masala and cook for a few more minutes.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with rice or Indian bread like roti or naan.

tips: Marinate the chicken with yogurt and spices beforehand for more flavor.
Adjust the amount of chili powder and garam masala according to your taste.
variations: Add vegetables like bell peppers or potatoes for extra texture.
For a creamier curry, add coconut milk or heavy cream.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving dish, garnished with a lemon wedge.
Pair with a side of cooling cucumber raita or a simple salad.
